recipe_title: Roasted Garlic and Rosemary Salt Potatoes
original_instructions:
For the rosemary salt potatoes:
Clean potatoes and place whole in stock pot. Add cold water to cover, add salt, cover and bring to boil. Remove lid and boil 18 to 20 minutes, until tender.
Remove from heat and drain. Return cooked potatoes to stock pot. Squeeze roasted garlic into pot, add butter, minced rosemary, and cracked pepper to taste, stir to coat potatoes. Serve 3 potatoes per plate.
Place garlic in aluminum foil square. Drizzle with olive oil and salt liberally. Wrap with foil and grill for an hour. Remove from heat and remove foil.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Clean 1 potato and place it whole in a small pot.
Add enough cold water to cover the potato, and add approximately 0.56 tablespoons of salt.
Cover the pot and bring to a boil.
Remove the lid and boil for 18 to 20 minutes, until the potato is tender.
Remove from heat and drain the water.
Return the cooked potato to the pot.
Squeeze a portion of roasted garlic (about 0.06 of a head) into the pot.
Add approximately 0.22 tablespoons of butter, a small amount of minced rosemary, and cracked black pepper to taste.
Stir to coat the potato with the mixture.
Serve the potato on a plate.

recipe_title: Roast Beef and Horseradish Tea Sandwiches
original_instructions:
Stir the sour cream, horseradish and salt together in a small bowl.
Using a butter knife or offset spatula, spread the horseradish cream on 1 side of each rye slice. Put 1 slice of roast beef on 12 of the pumpernickel slices. Finish each sandwich with a grind or two of pepper and the remaining bread. Arrange the sandwiches on a serving platter and serve immediately.
ingredients: 6 thin slices (about 6 ounces) roast beef, halved
step_by_step_instructions: Stir 0.04 cups sour cream, 0.13 tablespoons prepared horseradish, and 0.08 teaspoons salt together in a small bowl.
Using a butter knife or offset spatula, spread the horseradish cream on one side of 1 slice of rye bread.
Put 0.25 slices of roast beef on the prepared bread slice.
Finish the sandwich with a grind or two of black pepper and cover with another rye bread slice.
Arrange the sandwich on a plate and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium-high heat until nearly smoking. Add the popcorn kernels and immediately cover with a lid. Give the pan a shake and wait until you hear the kernels starting to pop. Shake the pan again, then lower the heat to medium and continue cooking until the popping slows and the kernels are popped, about 2 minutes more. Transfer the popcorn to a large bowl.
Melt the butter over medium heat in a small saute pan. Add the lemon zest, cayenne and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Swirl to mingle the flavors. Pour the butter mixture over the popcorn and toss gently to coat. Season with salt and serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat until nearly smoking.
Add 2 tablespoons of popcorn kernels and immediately cover with a lid.
Shake the pan and wait until you hear the kernels starting to pop.
Shake the pan again, lower the heat to medium, and continue cooking until the popping slows and the kernels are popped, about 2 minutes more.
Transfer the popcorn to a large bowl.
Melt 0.5 tablespoon unsalted butter over medium heat in a small saute pan.
Add the grated zest of 0.25 lemon, 0.03 teaspoon cayenne, and 0.13 teaspoon salt to the melted butter.
Swirl the pan to mingle the flavors.
Pour the butter mixture over the popcorn and toss gently to coat.
Season with additional salt to taste and serve.

recipe_title: Turkey Pot Pie in a Shell
original_instructions:
1. Prepare the pastry shells according to the package directions.
2. Heat the oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until tender.
3. Stir the soup, milk and peas and carrots in the skillet and heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling. Spoon the turkey mixture into the pastry shells.
ingredients: 1 package (10 ounces) Pepperidge Farm Puff Pastry Shells
1 can (10 3/4 ounces) Campbell's Condensed Cream of Chicken Soup (Regular, 98% Fat Free or Healthy Request)
1 package (10 ounces) frozen peas and carrots
step_by_step_instructions: Prepare 1 pastry shell according to the package directions.
Heat 0.17 tablespoon vegetable oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 0.08 cup chopped onion and cook until tender.
Stir 0.19 cup condensed cream of chicken soup, 0.08 cup milk, and 1.67 ounces frozen peas and carrots in the skillet and heat to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
Add 0.33 cup cubed cooked turkey and cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling.
Spoon the turkey mixture into the prepared pastry shell.
processed_ingredients: 0.19 cup condensed cream of chicken soup

original_instructions: Marinate lamb in white wine vinegar, oregano, oil and salt and pepper. Refrigerate, covered, for 24 hours. Preheat oven at 350 degrees. Roast lamb, potatoes and onions, uncovered for approximately 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
step_by_step_instructions: Mix 0.36 tbsp white wine vinegar, 0.03 tsp dried oregano, 0.36 tbsp olive oil, 0.07 tbsp salt, and 0.04 tbsp pepper to create a marinade.
Rub the marinade over 0.83 lb lamb, ensuring even coverage.
Cover and refrigerate the marinated lamb for 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Place the marinated lamb in a roasting pan.
Roast the lamb in the oven, uncovered, for approximately 90 to 120 minutes or until cooked to your preference.
Garnish the roasted lamb with chopped parsley before serving.

original_instructions:
Prepare barbecue grill (medium heat). Place onions on the grill and cover. Grill until onions are very tender when pierced with a skewer, about 15 minutes. Serve with salt. To pop the onion out of its papery skin, pick it up by the root end and squeeze.
Prepare barbecue grill (medium heat). Place onions on the grill and cover. Grill until onions are very tender when pierced with a skewer, about 15 minutes. Serve with salt. To pop the onion out of its papery skin, pick it up by the root end and squeeze.
step_by_step_instructions: Prepare a barbecue grill to medium heat.
Place approximately 4 ounces of red pearl onions on the grill and cover.
Grill until the onions are very tender when pierced with a skewer, about 15 minutes.
Serve with salt.
To pop the onion out of its papery skin, pick it up by the root end and squeeze.

recipe_title: Quick Cucumber Pickles with Rye Bread and Cheese
original_instructions:
Cut cucumbers crosswise into 1/8-inch-thick slices, then toss with kosher salt in a bowl and let stand 15 minutes. Rinse and drain cucumbers and pat dry with paper towels. Whisk together vinegar, sugar, mustard, horseradish, and dill until sugar is dissolved. Stir in cucumber and let stand at least 5 minutes. Slice bread and serve with pickles and cheese.
Cut cucumbers crosswise into 1/8-inch-thick slices, then toss with kosher salt in a bowl and let stand 15 minutes. Rinse and drain cucumbers and pat dry with paper towels.
Whisk together vinegar, sugar, mustard, horseradish, and dill until sugar is dissolved. Stir in cucumber and let stand at least 5 minutes.
Slice bread and serve with pickles and cheese.
ingredients: 2 (6- to 8-ounce) pieces semisoft cheese (preferably German, such as Cambozola or Mirabo)
step_by_step_instructions: Cut 0.25 English cucumber crosswise into 1/8-inch-thick slices.
Toss with 0.25 teaspoon kosher salt in a bowl and let stand for 15 minutes.
Rinse and drain cucumbers and pat dry with paper towels.
Whisk together 2 tablespoons cider vinegar, 1 tablespoon sugar, 0.25 tablespoon dry mustard, 0.5 teaspoon drained bottled horseradish, and 0.25 tablespoon chopped fresh dill until sugar is dissolved.
Stir in cucumber slices and let stand at least 5 minutes.
Slice 2 ounces of rye bread.
Serve with pickles and 2 ounces of semisoft cheese.

original_instructions:
Combine the smoked paprika, garlic powder, cumin, chili powder, five spice powder, dry mustard and some salt and pepper in a bowl. Using a sharp knife, score the skin of the duck so it has a 1/4-inch diamond pattern. Rub the spice mixture all over the duck.
Heat a grill to medium (make sure it's not too hot since the key is to cook duck slowly to render the fat) and wipe down the grates with an oiled towel. Place the duck skin-side down on the grate and cook until the skin is seared and the fat is rendered, 4 to 5 minutes. (If there are occasional flare-ups from the fat, move the duck around on the grill to a new spot away from the flame each time.) Flip the duck over and place on a cooler part of the grill. Cook for an additional 5 minutes for medium-rare. Let rest for 5 to 7 minutes before cutting against the grain into thick slices.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.25 tablespoon smoked paprika, 0.06 teaspoon garlic powder, 0.06 teaspoon ground cumin, 0.06 teaspoon chili powder, 0.03 teaspoon five spice powder, 0.03 teaspoon dry mustard and a pinch of salt and pepper in a bowl.
Using a sharp knife, score the skin of 1 duck breast half so it has a 1/4-inch diamond pattern.
Rub the spice mixture all over the duck breast.
Heat a grill to medium and wipe down the grates with an oiled towel.
Place the duck skin-side down on the grate and cook until the skin is seared and the fat is rendered, about 4 to 5 minutes.
Flip the duck breast over and place on a cooler part of the grill.
Cook for an additional 5 minutes for medium-rare.
Let rest for 5 to 7 minutes before cutting against the grain into thick slices.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a medium saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the shallot, tomatoes, peppers and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring often, until slightly softened and aromatic, about 4 minutes. Season with the salt and add the quinoa. Using a wooden spoon, stir to coat the quinoa in the oil. Add the chicken broth, stir and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and cook until the quinoa is tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Stir in the spinach to wilt and serve drizzled with olive oil.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes in oil, cut into 1/2-inch dice
1 yellow bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch dice
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium saucepan, heat 0.67 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
Add 0.17 shallot, chopped, 0.17 cup sun-dried tomatoes in oil, cut into 1/2-inch dice, 0.17 yellow bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch dice, and a pinch of red pepper flakes to the saucepan.
Cook, stirring often, until slightly softened and aromatic, about 4 minutes.
Season with a pinch of kosher salt and add 0.33 cup tricolor quinoa.
Using a wooden spoon, stir to coat the quinoa in the oil.
Add 0.42 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth, stir and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and cook until the quinoa is tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Stir in 0.67 cup baby spinach to wilt.
Serve drizzled with a small amount of olive oil.

original_instructions: In medium saucepan, bring the chicken stock and milk to a boil. Whisk in the polenta, stirring until the polenta just pulls from the side of the pot. Stir in the Manchego cheese and serve warm.
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium saucepan, bring 0.50 cups chicken stock and 0.25 cups milk to a boil.
Whisk in 0.25 cups quick-cooking polenta, stirring until the polenta just pulls from the side of the pot.
Stir in 0.25 cups shredded Manchego cheese and serve warm.

original_instructions:
Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook the beef, green peppers, onions, and mushrooms over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Drain pasta and place in a large bowl; stir in the beef mixture, 2 jars of spaghetti sauce and eggs. Transfer to 2 greased 13 by 9 by 2-inch baking dishes. Top with remaining sauce; sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until heated through.
step_by_step_instructions: Cook 1 cup of pasta according to package directions.

While the pasta is cooking, in a skillet, cook 0.25 lb of ground beef, 0.25 of a green pepper chopped, 0.25 of an onion chopped, and 0.25 cup of sliced fresh mushrooms over medium heat until the meat is no longer pink. Drain any excess fat.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Drain the cooked pasta and place it in a large bowl.
Stir in the beef mixture, 0.5 cup of spaghetti sauce, and 0.25 of a lightly beaten egg with the pasta.
Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish.
Top with an additional 0.5 cup of spaghetti sauce and sprinkle with 0.5 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese.
Bake, uncovered, for 25 minutes or until heated through.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash potatoes and poke 2 or 3 vent holes in each with a fork. Bake potatoes in oven until done, about 1 hour. (Poke with a fork and if fork goes in easily they are done). Remove potatoes from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Slice potatoes in 1/2 lengthwise and scoop pulp into mixing bowl being careful not to break skin. Mash potatoes with butter, cheese, milk, and chives. Taste-test and adjust seasoning if necessary with salt and pepper. Spoon mashed potatoes back into skins and place in a 9 by 13-inch dish. Return to oven and heat thoroughly.
ingredients: 3/4 cup milk, plus more if needed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Wash 1 large baking potato and poke 2 or 3 vent holes in it with a fork.
Bake the potato in the oven until done, about 1 hour. (Poke with a fork and if fork goes in easily it is done).
Remove the potato from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
Slice the potato in 1/2 lengthwise and scoop pulp into a mixing bowl being careful not to break the skin.
Mash the potato with 2 tablespoons of butter, 1/4 cup of grated Cheddar cheese, 3 tablespoons of milk, and 1/2 tablespoon of chopped chives.
Taste-test and adjust seasoning if necessary with salt and pepper.
Spoon mashed potatoes back into the skins and place in a 9 by 13-inch dish.
Return to the oven and heat thoroughly.

original_instructions:
Remove and chop the zest from the orange and add it to a large nonreactive bowl. Add the asparagus and cheese and toss together. Peel the orange and cut segments from the membrane. Add the segments to the bowl with the asparagus.
Squeeze the juice from the orange membrane into a small bowl and add the chives and white wine vinegar. Whisk in the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Add the dressing to the asparagus and let sit until the asparagus is slightly wilted, about 5 minutes. Toss in the hazelnuts and serve.
ingredients: 1 bunch thick green asparagus (1 pound), trimmed and thinly sliced on the bias
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons toasted hazelnuts, whole or coarsely chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Remove and chop the zest from one-quarter of an orange and add it to a large nonreactive bowl.
Add approximately 113 g of thinly sliced asparagus and 1 ounce of diced Pecorino Romano cheese to the bowl and toss together.
Peel one-quarter of the orange and cut segments from the membrane. Add these segments to the bowl with the asparagus.
Squeeze the juice from the remaining orange membrane into a small bowl and add 0.5 teaspoon of chopped chives and 0.25 teaspoon of white wine vinegar.
Whisk in 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil into the mixture and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Add the dressing to the asparagus mixture and let sit until the asparagus is slightly wilted, about 5 minutes.
Toss in approximately 0.5 tablespoon of toasted hazelnuts and serve.

original_instructions: In saute pan, add olive oil. Sweat onions and celery in oil. Set aside. In a separate bowl, mix crab meat, mayonnaise, parsley, bread crumbs and onion-celery mixture. Chill.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.05 ounce olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat.
Add 0.025 of a medium yellow onion (small dice) and 0.05 stalk celery (small dice) to the pan.
Sweat the onions and celery in the oil until they are soft and translucent, then set aside to cool.
In a separate bowl, combine 4 ounces crab meat, 0.02 cup mayonnaise, 0.2 tablespoon parsley (chopped), 0.075 ounce Japanese bread crumbs, and the cooled onion-celery mixture.
Mix all ingredients well and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipe_title: Steam/Sauteed Green Beans with Butter and Tarragon
original_instructions:
Bring the water, butter, salt and green beans to a boil in a Dutch oven or large deep skillet. Cover and steam over medium-high heat until the vegetable is brightly colored and just tender, 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove the lid and continue to cook until the liquid evaporates, 1 to 2 minutes longer, adding the tarragon at this point. Saute to intensify flavors, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Adjust seasonings, including pepper to taste, and serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Bring 40 ml water, 1.25 g salt, 4.25 g butter, and 113.40 g green beans to a boil in a Dutch oven or large deep skillet.
Cover and steam over medium-high heat until the vegetable is brightly colored and just tender, about 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove the lid and continue to cook until the liquid evaporates, about 1 to 2 minutes longer.
Add 2 g minced fresh tarragon and saute to intensify flavors, about 1 to 2 minutes longer.
Adjust seasonings, including pepper to taste, and serve.

recipe_title: Lime Marinated Chicken Wings with Avocado Dip
original_instructions:
In a blender, puree until smooth the jalapeno pepper, garlic, vegetable oil, tomato paste, salt, honey and lime juice. Pour marinade over the chicken. Add the lime zest and toss to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Preheat boiler to medium heat.
Arrange chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Broil chicken at least 6 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side; or until chicken is crispy on the outside and cooked through. Serve with Avocado Dip.
Pit and peel avocado. Place avocado in a medium bowl; mash. Fold in 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves; lime juice, garlic and salt; and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.
ingredients: 3 pounds chicken wings, rinsed and patted dry
step_by_step_instructions: In a blender, puree until smooth 0.08 jalapeno pepper, 0.33 cloves garlic, 0.01 cup vegetable oil, 0.05 tablespoon tomato paste, a pinch of salt, 0.33 tablespoons honey, and 0.25 limes' juice.
Pour the marinade over 0.25 pounds of chicken wings.
Add 0.02 lime zested and toss to coat.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Preheat the broiler to medium heat.
Arrange the chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Broil the chicken at least 6 inches from the heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until crispy on the outside and cooked through.
Pit and peel 0.25 avocado, and place it in a medium bowl; mash.
Fold in 0.75 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro leaves, 0.38 teaspoons lime juice, 0.25 clove garlic minced, 0.06 teaspoon salt, and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.
Serve the chicken wings with avocado dip.

original_instructions:
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the potatoes, sprinkle with salt and pepper and saute until golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes.
Add the onions and peppers and continue cooking an additional 5 minutes. Add the cabbage and Worcestershire sauce and saute until the vegetables are tender, about 3 minutes longer. Stir in the corned beef and cream and reduce the heat to medium-low.
Crack the eggs over the hash. Cover with a lid and cook until the eggs are set, 8 to 10 minutes. Serve the hash divided among 4 plates.
ingredients: Kosher salt and cracked black pepper
8 ounces corned beef, thinly sliced crosswise into strips
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.75 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 4 ounces baby red potatoes, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and saute until golden brown, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Add 0.25 of a Spanish onion and 0.25 of a red bell pepper, and continue cooking for an additional 5 minutes.
Add 0.25 cup shredded cabbage and 0.5 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, and saute until the vegetables are tender, about 3 minutes longer.
Stir in 2 ounces corned beef and 1 tablespoon heavy cream, and reduce the heat to medium-low.
Crack 1 egg over the hash.
Cover with a lid and cook until the egg is set, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Serve the hash on a plate.

original_instructions: In a saucepan, heat oil over medium high heat. Stir in rice and cook for 1 minute. Pour in coconut milk and chicken stock and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove pan from heat and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Serve hot.
step_by_step_instructions: In a saucepan, heat 0.67 tablespoon vegetable oil over medium high heat.
Stir in 0.33 cup long grain white rice and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in 0.33 cup coconut milk and 0.33 cup chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove pan from heat and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
Serve hot.

original_instructions:
Put beans in a stock pot. Add extra virgin olive oil and flour. Stir mixture and cover. Add pork rind. Cover mixture with water. Cook for 1 1/2 hours over medium-low heat. Skim off impurities if necessary.
Saute onions, garlic, sage, rosemary and celery leaves in 1 tablespoon olive oil over low flame, about 10 minutes. Add them to pot of garbanzo beans after beans have cooked for 1 1/2 hours. Chop celery stalks and add to pot. Add potato, carrots, broccoli rabe, leeks and cabbage to pot. Simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Skim to remove impurities if necessary. Add additional water if soup is too thick. Soup is done when beans are tender and potatoes are no longer solid. Season with salt and pepper. Soup can be served with olive oil, toasted bread and Parmesan cheese if desired.
ingredients: 4 cups dried garbanzo beans, soaked in water with 1 teaspoon baking soda for 24 hours and drained
1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, plus 1 tablespoon
1/2 pound pork rind, boiled for 20 minutes and cut into thin strips
Leaves from 2 stalks of celery, hold ribs aside
1 baking potato, peeled and cut in half
step_by_step_instructions: Soak 0.5 cup of dried garbanzo beans in water with a pinch of baking soda for 24 hours, then drain.
In a stock pot, add the soaked garbanzo beans, 0.5 tbsp of extra virgin olive oil, and 0.25 tbsp of flour.
Stir the mixture and cover the pot.
Add 0.06 lb of pork rind to the pot.
Cover the mixture with approximately 1.25 cups of water.
Cook over medium-low heat for 1.5 hours, skimming off impurities if necessary.

In a separate pan, sauté 0.06 cup of finely chopped onion, 0.25 clove of minced garlic, a small amount of chopped fresh sage, a small amount of chopped rosemary, and a few leaves from celery stalks in 0.12 tbsp of olive oil over low heat for about 10 minutes.
Add the sautéed mixture to the pot of garbanzo beans after they have cooked for 1.5 hours.
Chop a few stalks of celery and add to the pot.

Add 0.12 of a peeled and halved baking potato, 0.25 carrot sliced, 0.06 cup of chopped broccoli rabe, 0.25 of a sliced leek (white part only), and a small amount of chiffonade cabbage leaves to the pot.
Simmer for another 1.5 hours, skimming to remove impurities if necessary.
Add additional water if the soup is too thick.
Check if the soup is done by ensuring the beans are tender and the potatoes are no longer solid.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the soup with a drizzle of olive oil, a piece of toasted bread, and a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese if desired.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Place the tuna, onions, mustard, eggs, lemon juice, salt, pepper and 1/4 cup of the bread crumbs into a medium mixing bowl and stir to combine. Divide the mixture into 8 rounds and set aside on a parchment lined half sheet pan. Allow to rest for 15 minutes. Place the remaining bread crumbs into a pie plate. One at a time, coat each round in the panko on all sides.
Heat enough olive oil to cover the bottom of a 12-inch saute pan over medium heat until shimmering. Add the croquettes and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove to a cooling rack set over a half sheet pan lined with paper towels. Allow to cool for 2 to 3 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 1 (7-ounce) pouch albacore tuna, drained well and shredded by hand
step_by_step_instructions: Place 0.88 ounces of albacore tuna, 0.25 tablespoons of chopped green onions, 0.25 teaspoons of Dijon mustard, 0.25 large beaten eggs, 0.13 teaspoons of freshly squeezed lemon juice, 0.06 teaspoons of kosher salt, 0.03 teaspoons of freshly ground black pepper, and 0.09 cups of panko bread crumbs into a medium mixing bowl and stir to combine.
Divide the mixture into 1 round and set aside on a parchment-lined half sheet pan.
Allow the mixture to rest for 15 minutes.
Place 0.19 cups of remaining bread crumbs into a pie plate.
Coat the round in the panko on all sides.
Heat enough olive oil to cover the bottom of a 12-inch sauté pan over medium heat until shimmering.
Add the croquette and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Remove to a cooling rack set over a half sheet pan lined with paper towels.
Allow to cool for 2 to 3 minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray 2-quart shallow baking dish with nonstick cooking spray; set aside.
Cover potatoes with water in 4-quart saucepot; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and cook 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender; drain and mash.
Stir in 1 cup cheese, Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise, sour cream, green onions and 4 strips crumbled bacon. Turn into prepared baking dish and bake 30 minutes or until bubbling.
Top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and bacon. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Garnish, if desired, with additional chopped green onions.
ingredients: 3 lbs. all-purpose potatoes, peeled and cubed
1-1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese (about 6 oz.), divided
1 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Spray a small portion of a 2-quart shallow baking dish with nonstick cooking spray; set aside.
Cover a small portion of potatoes with water in a small saucepot; bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low and cook for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender; drain and mash.
Stir in about 0.17 cup cheese, 0.17 cup mayonnaise, 0.17 cup sour cream, a small portion of green onions, and 0.67 slice crumbled bacon.
Turn into prepared baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until bubbling.
Top with remaining cheese and bacon. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Garnish, if desired, with additional chopped green onions.

original_instructions:
Boil wine, spices, salt, bay leaf, and garlic in a deep 10-inch heavy skillet 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and oil, then reduce heat and gently simmer, uncovered, until mushrooms are barely tender, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cool mushrooms in liquid, uncovered. Chill, covered, at least 8 hours for flavors to meld. Discard bay leaf and whole spices. Serve at room temperature.
Boil wine, spices, salt, bay leaf, and garlic in a deep 10-inch heavy skillet 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and oil, then reduce heat and gently simmer, uncovered, until mushrooms are barely tender, about 15 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cool mushrooms in liquid, uncovered. Chill, covered, at least 8 hours for flavors to meld. Discard bay leaf and whole spices. Serve at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 lb small (1-inch) white or cremini mushrooms, trimmed
step_by_step_instructions: Boil 0.25 cup dry white wine, 0.125 teaspoon whole coriander seeds, 0.0625 teaspoon whole black peppercorns, 0.1875 teaspoon salt, 0.125 bay leaf, and 0.75 garlic cloves, peeled and smashed, in a deep skillet for 5 minutes.
Add 0.25 lb small white or cremini mushrooms and 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil.
Reduce heat and gently simmer, uncovered, until mushrooms are barely tender, about 15 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and cool mushrooms in liquid, uncovered.
Chill, covered, at least 8 hours for flavors to meld.
Discard bay leaf and whole spices.
Serve at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: a candy thermometer
Line a baking sheet with wax paper; set aside. Place the popcorn in a large bowl; set aside.
In a heavy medium pot, stir to combine the molasses, sugar, butter and vinegar. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce to a simmer and cook until the mixture reaches 260 degrees F (hard ball stage) on a candy thermometer, 5 to 8 minutes. Let cool for about 5 minutes, then pour over the popcorn; fold and mix to coat using a rubber spatula. Let the popcorn cool slightly.
Coat your hands well with butter and form the popcorn mixture into 1/2-cup balls, squeezing to keep the popcorn together. Place on the prepared baking sheet and let sit until completely cooled and hardened, about 20 minutes.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for coating hands
step_by_step_instructions: Line a baking sheet with wax paper and set aside.
Place 1.25 cups (0.55 ounces) of popped popcorn in a large bowl and set aside.
In a heavy medium pot, stir to combine 0.13 cups molasses, 0.13 cups sugar, 0.25 tablespoons unsalted butter, and 0.13 teaspoons apple cider vinegar.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce to a simmer and cook until the mixture reaches 260 degrees F on a candy thermometer, about 5 to 8 minutes.
Let the mixture cool for about 5 minutes.
Pour the mixture over the popcorn and fold and mix to coat using a rubber spatula.
Let the popcorn cool slightly.
Coat your hands well with butter and form the popcorn mixture into 1/2-cup balls, squeezing to keep the popcorn together.
Place the popcorn balls on the prepared baking sheet and let sit until completely cooled and hardened, about 20 minutes.

original_instructions: In a small mixing bowl thoroughly combine softened butter, cayenne pepper, and paprika. In a large deep-sided skillet over medium-high heat, melt the cayenne butter and add the mushrooms, scallions and lobster meat. Saute until mushroom are golden, about 5 minutes, and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Carefully add the whiskey off the heat and cook until almost completely evaporated. Add the cream and reduce until thickened. Serve in large bowls over hot rice.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: In a small mixing bowl, thoroughly combine 1 tablespoon of softened butter, 0.13 teaspoon of cayenne pepper, and 0.25 teaspoon of paprika.
In a large deep-sided skillet over medium-high heat, melt the cayenne butter.
Add 0.19 cup of sliced mushrooms, 0.06 cup of sliced scallions, and 0.25 pound of cooked lobster meat. Saute until mushroom are golden, about 5 minutes, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Carefully add 0.06 cup of whiskey off the heat and cook until almost completely evaporated.
Add 1 cup of cream and reduce until thickened.
Serve in a large bowl over 0.5 cup of hot rice.

original_instructions:
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the spinach and garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until the spinach is wilted, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the mixture to a blender or food processor, pour in 1/4 cup hot water and pulse until pureed. Set aside.
In a large soup pot, cook the onions in the butter over medium heat until the onions begin to soften. Sprinkle the flour over the top and stir to combine. Cook for about 2 minutes, then pour in the milk, stirring occasionally. Add the salt, cayenne and some black pepper and stir to combine. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Pour in the pureed spinach, then cook until thickened, another 3 to 5 minutes.
Check the seasonings, adding more salt, black pepper or cayenne as needed. Serve warm.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons kosher salt, or more to taste
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or more to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add approximately 2.5 ounces of fresh spinach and 0.5 clove of finely minced garlic to the skillet.
Cook, stirring constantly, until the spinach is wilted, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Transfer the spinach mixture to a blender or food processor.
Add 1 tablespoon of hot water and pulse until pureed.
Set the spinach puree aside.
In a large soup pot, melt 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat.
Add 1/8 of a medium onion, chopped, to the pot.
Cook the onion until it begins to soften.
Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of all-purpose flour over the onions and stir to combine.
Cook for about 2 minutes, then pour in 3/4 cup of whole milk, stirring occasionally.
Add 0.5 teaspoon of kosher salt, 0.125 teaspoon of cayenne pepper, and some freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Stir to combine and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour in the pureed spinach and cook until thickened, another 3 to 5 minutes.
Check the seasonings, adding more salt, black pepper, or cayenne as needed.
Serve the soup warm.

original_instructions:
Cut corn kernels from ears, discarding cobs. Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then saute corn, seasoning with salt and pepper, to taste, stirring, until tender, about 4 minutes.
Add garlic and saute, stirring, 1 minute. Add vinegar and cook, stirring, until most is evaporated, about 1 minute. Add tomatoes and cook, gently stirring, 1 minute.
Remove skillet from heat and stir in scallions.
Transfer vegetables to a large plate to cool and season with salt and pepper.
Salad can be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 bunches scallion greens, coarsely chopped to yield 1/2 cup
step_by_step_instructions: Cut kernels from 1 ear of fresh corn, discarding the cob.
Heat 0.5 tbsp of extra-virgin olive oil in a large heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking.
Saute the corn, seasoning with salt and pepper to taste, stirring, until tender, about 4 minutes.
Add 0.5 clove of minced garlic and saute, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add 0.25 tbsp of balsamic vinegar and cook, stirring, until most is evaporated, about 1 minute.
Add 4 ounces of halved cherry tomatoes and cook, gently stirring, for 1 minute.
Remove skillet from heat and stir in 2 tbsp of coarsely chopped scallion greens.
Transfer vegetables to a large plate to cool and season with salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a small bowl whisk together the oil, vinegar, mustard, and salt and pepper, to taste.
Add the pasta and the leftover root vegetables to a large serving bowl. Stir in the parsley and the sliced red onion. Toss with the vinaigrette and refrigerate to let the flavors develop, about 1 hour.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 ounces penne pasta, cooked and cooled
2 to 3 cups leftover Roasted Root Vegetable Salad recipe, roughly chopped
step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together approximately 0.50 tablespoons of canola oil, 0.25 tablespoons of cider vinegar, 0.25 tablespoons of spicy brown mustard, and salt and pepper to taste.
Add about 2 ounces of cooked and cooled penne pasta and roughly 0.50 cups of leftover roasted root vegetables to a large serving bowl.
Stir in approximately 0.25 tablespoons of chopped fresh parsley leaves and 0.25 of a medium onion, sliced.
Toss everything with the prepared vinaigrette.
Refrigerate the salad to let the flavors develop for about 1 hour.

recipe_title: Breakfast Tacos with Chorizo, Egg and Potato
original_instructions:
For the pico de gallo: Mix together the tomatoes, lime juice, cilantro, garlic, avocados and onions in a medium bowl. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Cover and chill.
For the tacos: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute the chorizo until cooked through, breaking up with back of wooden spoon, about 5 minutes. Transfer the chorizo to a paper-towel-lined-plate. Add the potatoes and cook, covered, stirring occasionally until soft, 6 to 8 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined-plate. Whisk the eggs and sprinkle with salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add the eggs to the same skillet and cook over medium heat, stirring until the eggs are softly set, 1 to 2 minutes. Return the chorizo and potatoes to the skillet and toss with the eggs to warm through and finish cooking the eggs. Toast the tortillas in a small skillet over medium-high heat, topping each tortilla evenly with the cheese, until the cheese melts and the tortillas begin to crisp on the bottom, about 1 minute. Transfer to a platter. Put 1/2 cup of the egg and chorizo mixture in each tortilla and top with 1 tablespoon of the pico de gallo. Reserve any leftover pico de gallo for another use. Fold each tortilla in half and serve with the sour cream and hot sauce.
ingredients: 8 ounces plum tomatoes, seeded and chopped (about 3 tomatoes)
1/2 ripe avocado, halved, pitted and chopped
Kosher salt and cracked black pepper
Kosher salt and freshly cracked pepper
8 ounces fresh Mexican-style chorizo sausage, casing removed (about 6 links)
4 ounces new potatoes, peeled and diced into 1/2-inch cubes (about 2 medium)
step_by_step_instructions: Mix together approximately 1.33 ounces of chopped plum tomatoes, 0.5 tablespoons of lime juice, 0.33 tablespoons of chopped fresh cilantro leaves, 0.17 cloves of minced garlic, 0.08 ripe avocado, and 0.04 medium red onion in a bowl. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Cover and chill.

Heat 0.17 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saute about 1.33 ounces of chorizo until cooked through, breaking up with a spoon, for about 5 minutes. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate.

Add approximately 0.67 ounces of diced potatoes to the skillet and cook, covered, stirring occasionally until soft, 6 to 8 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate.
Whisk 1 egg and sprinkle with salt and pepper in a bowl.
Add the egg to the same skillet and cook over medium heat, stirring until the egg is softly set, 1 to 2 minutes.
Return the chorizo and potatoes to the skillet and toss with the egg to warm through and finish cooking.

Toast 1 tortilla in a small skillet over medium-high heat, topping with 0.25 cups of grated cheese, until the cheese melts and the tortilla begins to crisp on the bottom, about 1 minute. Transfer to a platter.

Put approximately 0.5 cups of the egg and chorizo mixture in the tortilla and top with 0.25 tablespoons of the pico de gallo. Fold the tortilla in half and serve with 1 tablespoon of sour cream and hot sauce.

recipe_title: Duck and Sausage Gumbo with Brown and White Rice
original_instructions:
To prepare the gumbo: Prick duck skin all over with tip of a knife. In a heavy skillet brown kielbasa and duck in batches over moderately high heat, transferring as browned to paper towels to drain. Combine kielbasa and duck with broth and water in a 6-gallon kettle and bring to a simmer.
Prick duck skin all over with tip of a knife. In a heavy skillet brown kielbasa and duck in batches over moderately high heat, transferring as browned to paper towels to drain. Combine kielbasa and duck with broth and water in a 6-gallon kettle and bring to a simmer.
Pour off all but 1/4 cup fat from skillet. Add flour and cook roux over moderately low heat, stirring constantly, until a shade darker than peanut butter, about 30 minutes. Add onions, celery, and bell peppers and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add vegetable mixture to kettle and stir until roux is dissolved. Simmer gumbo, uncovered, 2 hours and let cool completely. Bone duck, discarding skin and bones. Chill gumbo overnight. Gumbo may be made 2 days in advance and kept covered and chilled. Discard fat on surface and reheat gumbo with cayenne, scallions, and salt to taste over moderate heat.
Pour off all but 1/4 cup fat from skillet. Add flour and cook roux over moderately low heat, stirring constantly, until a shade darker than peanut butter, about 30 minutes. Add onions, celery, and bell peppers and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add vegetable mixture to kettle and stir until roux is dissolved.
Simmer gumbo, uncovered, 2 hours and let cool completely. Bone duck, discarding skin and bones. Chill gumbo overnight. Gumbo may be made 2 days in advance and kept covered and chilled. Discard fat on surface and reheat gumbo with cayenne, scallions, and salt to taste over moderate heat.
To prepare the rice: To a kettle of boiling salted water add brown rice, stirring, and boil 15 minutes. Drain rice in a large colander and rinse. Put colander over a kettle of boiling water and steam brown rice, covered with a kitchen towel and a lid, until fluffy and dry, about 25 minutes. Cook white rice in same manner, boiling 10 minutes and steaming 15 minutes. In a bowl toss brown and white rice together. Rice may be made 3 days in advance and kept chilled in resealable plastic bags. Steam rice to reheat.
To a kettle of boiling salted water add brown rice, stirring, and boil 15 minutes. Drain rice in a large colander and rinse. Put colander over a kettle of boiling water and steam brown rice, covered with a kitchen towel and a lid, until fluffy and dry, about 25 minutes. Cook white rice in same manner, boiling 10 minutes and steaming 15 minutes. In a bowl toss brown and white rice together. Rice may be made 3 days in advance and kept chilled in resealable plastic bags. Steam rice to reheat.
Serve gumbo over rice.
Serve gumbo over rice.
ingredients: two 5 1/2-pound ducks, excess fat discarded and ducks cut into serving pieces
2 pounds kielbasa (Polish smoked sausage), cut into 1/4-inch-thick rounds)
step_by_step_instructions: Prick about 1/8 of a duck skin all over with the tip of a knife.
In a heavy skillet, brown approximately 3.2 ounces of kielbasa and 1/8 of the duck in batches over moderately high heat, transferring as browned to paper towels to drain.
Combine the browned kielbasa and duck with about 1.5 cups of broth and 0.75 cups of water in a kettle and bring to a simmer.
Pour off all but 1/4 cup fat from the skillet.
Add 0.5 tablespoons of flour and cook the roux over moderately low heat, stirring constantly, until a shade darker than peanut butter, about 30 minutes.
Add approximately 0.25 of an onion, 0.25 of a celery rib, and 1/16 of a red bell pepper and green bell pepper each, and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Add the vegetable mixture to the kettle and stir until the roux is dissolved.
Simmer the gumbo, uncovered, for 2 hours and let it cool completely.
Bone the portion of duck, discarding skin and bones.
Chill the gumbo overnight.
Discard fat on the surface and reheat gumbo with 0.125 teaspoon of cayenne, 0.25 cup of scallions, and salt to taste over moderate heat.
To prepare the rice, add approximately 0.1875 cups of brown rice to a kettle of boiling salted water, stirring, and boil for 15 minutes.
Drain the brown rice in a large colander and rinse.
Put the colander over a kettle of boiling water and steam brown rice, covered with a kitchen towel and a lid, until fluffy and dry, about 25 minutes.
Cook the same portion of white rice in the same manner, boiling for 10 minutes and steaming for 15 minutes.
In a bowl, toss the steamed brown and white rice together.
Serve the gumbo over the rice.

original_instructions:
In a heavy 3 to 4-quart saucepan melt the butter over moderate heat. When the foam begins to subside, stir in 3/4 cup of the flour and mix well. Add the milk in a stream whisking constantly. Cook over high heat until the sauce comes to a boil and thickens. Simmer for another 10 minutes on low heat, whisking often.
Take the pan off the heat and beat in the egg yolks, one at a time, using a wooden spoon. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the grated cheese and mix well. Pour into a greased baking dish (8 by 6-inches) and spread into a 1/2-inch thick layer. Use a spatula to smooth the top. Allow to cool to room temperature, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 8 hours, or overnight, until firm.
Using a pastry wheel or a sharp knife, cut the mixture into 2-inch squares and transfer them to a sheet of waxed paper. Dredge each square into the remaining flour and coat completely. Shake off excess flour and dip into the egg wash, followed by the bread crumbs. Pat the square gently with a spatula to help the crumbs adhere. Repeat with all the squares and place them on a baking sheet. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, until the coating is firm.
In a deep fryer or heavy saucepan, heat 2 to 3-inches of oil until it reaches 375 degrees. Preheat the oven to its lowest temperature. Line a baking dish with paper towels and set in the middle of the oven.
Deep-fry the squares 3 or 4 at a time, turning them with a slotted spoon for about 5 minutes, until golden brown on both sides. As they brown, transfer them to a baking dish in the oven to keep them warm while you deep-fry the rest. Serve at once as a first course or an accompaniment to the drinks.
ingredients: 1 cup freshly grated imported Swiss Gruyere cheese (about 1/4 pound)
1 cup freshly grated imported Swiss Emmentaler cheese (about 1/4 pound)
2 eggs beaten together with 1/3 cup milk
step_by_step_instructions: Melt 0.67 tablespoons of butter in a heavy saucepan over moderate heat.
Stir in 0.21 cups of all-purpose flour and mix well.
Add 0.25 cups of milk in a stream, whisking constantly.
Cook over high heat until the sauce comes to a boil and thickens.
Simmer for another 10 minutes on low heat, whisking often.
Take the pan off the heat and beat in 1 egg yolk, using a wooden spoon.
Season with 0.17 teaspoons of salt and 0.02 teaspoons of white pepper.
Add 0.13 cups of freshly grated Gruyere cheese and 0.13 cups of freshly grated Emmentaler cheese, then mix well.
Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish, spreading into a 0.5-inch thick layer.
Allow to cool to room temperature, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight until firm.
Cut the mixture into 2-inch squares using a pastry wheel or sharp knife.
Dredge each square into 0.04 cups of flour, then shake off excess.
Dip into an egg wash made from 0.33 eggs beaten together with 0.06 cups of milk.
Coat with 0.17 cups of dried bread crumbs, patting gently with a spatula to help the crumbs adhere.
Refrigerate the coated squares for at least 1 hour until the coating is firm.
Heat 2 to 3 inches of vegetable oil in a deep fryer or heavy saucepan until it reaches 375 degrees.
Preheat the oven to its lowest temperature and line a baking dish with paper towels.
Deep-fry the squares, 3 or 4 at a time, turning them with a slotted spoon for about 5 minutes until golden brown on both sides.
Transfer browned squares to the baking dish in the oven to keep warm while frying the rest.
Serve immediately as a first course or an accompaniment to drinks.

original_instructions:
Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the dumplings in a single layer. Cook until browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Add 1/4 cup water to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until evaporated, about 1 minute; transfer the dumplings to a bowl.
Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the skillet. Add the vegetables and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender and lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes; transfer to the bowl with the dumplings.
Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the skillet. Add the shrimp, ginger and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp are just cooked through, about 2 minutes. Return the dumplings and vegetables to the skillet and stir to combine. Add the chili sauce and soy sauce; cook, stirring gently, until glazed, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the rice vinegar and half of the scallions. Top with the remaining scallions.
ingredients: 1 18-ounce bag mixed fresh stir-fry vegetables, large pieces halved (about 6 cups)
1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add approximately 3.25 ounces of dumplings in a single layer. Cook until browned, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Add 1 tablespoon of water to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until evaporated, about 1 minute; transfer the dumplings to a bowl.

Heat 0.33 tablespoon vegetable oil in the skillet. Add approximately 1.5 cups of mixed vegetables and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender and lightly browned, about 8 to 10 minutes; transfer to the bowl with the dumplings.

Heat the remaining 0.33 tablespoon vegetable oil in the skillet. Add about 0.25 pound of shrimp, 0.17 tablespoon finely chopped ginger, and 0.33 clove garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp are just cooked through, about 2 minutes.
Return the dumplings and vegetables to the skillet and stir to combine.
Add 1.33 tablespoons of sweet Thai chili sauce and 0.67 tablespoon of soy sauce; cook, stirring gently, until glazed, about 1 minute.
Remove from the heat and stir in 0.33 tablespoon of rice vinegar and half of 0.33 scallion. Top with the remaining scallion.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Place the panko in a pie dish. In another pie dish, beat the eggs to blend. Line a large cutting board with plastic wrap. Place 2 swordfish steaks on plastic wrap, about 2 inches apart. Place another sheet of plastic wrap over the steaks. Using the flat side of a meat mallet or a heavy rolling pin, gently flatten the swordfish steaks to 1/4-inch thick. Remove top plastic wrap and sprinkle the swordfish with salt and pepper on both sides. Set aside the swordfish steaks and flatten and season remaining 2 steaks, using the plastic wrap to help again. Dip each steak into the egg, then the panko, coating completely and patting to adhere.
Working in batches, melt 2 tablespoons of butter with 2 tablespoon of light olive oil in a heavy large frying pan over medium-high heat. Place 2 coated swordfish steaks in pan and cook until brown and crisp and just cooked through in the middle, about 1 1/2 minutes per side. Transfer to a cooling rack set on a baking sheet and lightly tent with foil to keep warm (do not seal with foil or the breading will become soggy). Repeat with the remaining butter, olive oil, and 2 swordfish steaks.
Whisk the lemon juice and extra-virgin olive oil in a large bowl to blend. Add the arugula and watercress, and toss lightly to coat. Season the salad, to taste, with salt and pepper. Transfer the swordfish steaks to plates. Top with the salad and serve.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Place approximately 0.38 cups of panko in a pie dish.
In another pie dish, beat 0.75 large eggs to blend.
Line a large cutting board with plastic wrap. Place 1 swordfish steak on plastic wrap, about 2 inches apart. Place another sheet of plastic wrap over the steak.
Using the flat side of a meat mallet or a heavy rolling pin, gently flatten the swordfish steak to 1/4-inch thick.
Remove top plastic wrap and sprinkle the swordfish with salt and pepper on both sides.
Dip the steak into the egg, then the panko, coating completely and patting to adhere.
Melt 0.5 tablespoons of butter with 0.5 tablespoons of light olive oil in a heavy large frying pan over medium-high heat.
Place the coated swordfish steak in the pan and cook until brown and crisp and just cooked through in the middle, about 1.5 minutes per side.
Transfer to a cooling rack set on a baking sheet and lightly tent with foil to keep warm (do not seal with foil or the breading will become soggy).
Whisk approximately 0.25 of a lemon's juice and 0.5 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil in a large bowl to blend.
Add approximately 0.75 cups of arugula and 0.25 bunch of watercress, and toss lightly to coat.
Season the salad, to taste, with salt and pepper.
Transfer the swordfish steak to a plate. Top with the salad and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400°F/200°C/gas 6. Cut the potatoes into thin matchsticks using a julienne attachment on a mandoline or food processor. Or, cut into thin rounds and use a sharp knife to cut the rounds into strips {more time consuming, but it works!} Heat the butter and olive oil in an 8-in/20-cm ovenproof cast-iron or non-stick frying pan, over medium heat. Add the rosemary to the potatoes, and season with salt and pepper. Increase the heat to medium-high and cook, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are soft and a few pieces are brown. At this point, the potatoes should have settled into a round flat pancake. Transfer the potatoes in the skillet to the hot oven to bake until the top and bottom are golden and crispy and the center is soft but cooked through, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and slide out of the pan onto paper towels/absorbent papers. Slide onto a baking sheet/tray and continue until the top and bottom are cooked to a deep golden brown, about 10 minutes more. Serve in wedges or whole on a plate in the middle of the table for breaking and nibbling.
Preheat the oven to 400°F/200°C/gas 6.
Cut the potatoes into thin matchsticks using a julienne attachment on a mandoline or food processor. Or, cut into thin rounds and use a sharp knife to cut the rounds into strips {more time consuming, but it works!}
Heat the butter and olive oil in an 8-in/20-cm ovenproof cast-iron or non-stick frying pan, over medium heat. Add the rosemary to the potatoes, and season with salt and pepper. Increase the heat to medium-high and cook, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are soft and a few pieces are brown. At this point, the potatoes should have settled into a round flat pancake.
Transfer the potatoes in the skillet to the hot oven to bake until the top and bottom are golden and crispy and the center is soft but cooked through, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and slide out of the pan onto paper towels/absorbent papers. Slide onto a baking sheet/tray and continue until the top and bottom are cooked to a deep golden brown, about 10 minutes more. Serve in wedges or whole on a plate in the middle of the table for breaking and nibbling.
ingredients: 2 medium baking potatoes {Idaho or russet}, peeled {1 1/4 lb/570 g}
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F/200°C/gas 6.
Cut 1 medium potato into thin matchsticks using a julienne attachment on a mandoline or food processor.
Heat 1 tablespoon unsalted butter and a small amount of olive oil in an 8-inch ovenproof frying pan over medium heat.
Add 1 tablespoon rosemary leaves to the potatoes if using, and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Increase the heat to medium-high and cook, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are soft and a few pieces are brown.
Allow the potatoes to settle into a round flat pancake.
Transfer the potatoes in the skillet to the hot oven to bake until the top and bottom are golden and crispy and the center is soft but cooked through, about 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and slide out of the pan onto paper towels to absorb excess oil.
Slide onto a baking sheet and continue cooking until the top and bottom are cooked to a deep golden brown, about 10 minutes more.
Serve in wedges or whole on a plate.

original_instructions:
With a vegetable peeler remove two 2-inch-long strips zest from lemon and squeeze 1 teaspoon juice into a small cup. In a small saucepan simmer chicken and zest in broth, covered, 20 minutes, or until chicken is just cooked through. Transfer chicken to a bowl and pour broth through a sieve into a 4-cup measuring cup. Chill chicken until it is cool. While chicken is cooling, trim snow peas and cut diagonally into thin slivers. In a 2-quart saucepan heat butter over moderately low heat until foam subsides and stir in flour. Cook roux, stirring constantly, 2 minutes. Add broth and cream in a stream, whisking, and simmer, whisking, 2 minutes, or until soup thickens slightly. Remove pan from heat. When chicken is cool enough to handle, discard skin and bones and cut chicken into thin strips. Add chicken and snow peas to soup and simmer, stirring occasionally, 1 minute, or until peas are crisp-tender. Stir in lemon juice, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste.
With a vegetable peeler remove two 2-inch-long strips zest from lemon and squeeze 1 teaspoon juice into a small cup. In a small saucepan simmer chicken and zest in broth, covered, 20 minutes, or until chicken is just cooked through. Transfer chicken to a bowl and pour broth through a sieve into a 4-cup measuring cup. Chill chicken until it is cool.
While chicken is cooling, trim snow peas and cut diagonally into thin slivers. In a 2-quart saucepan heat butter over moderately low heat until foam subsides and stir in flour. Cook roux, stirring constantly, 2 minutes. Add broth and cream in a stream, whisking, and simmer, whisking, 2 minutes, or until soup thickens slightly. Remove pan from heat.
When chicken is cool enough to handle, discard skin and bones and cut chicken into thin strips. Add chicken and snow peas to soup and simmer, stirring occasionally, 1 minute, or until peas are crisp-tender. Stir in lemon juice, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste.
ingredients: 2 chicken breast halves with skin and bones (about 3/4 pound)
2 tablespoons minced fresh flat-leafed parsley leaves
step_by_step_instructions: With a vegetable peeler, remove two 1-inch-long strips of zest from the lemon and squeeze about 1/3 teaspoon of juice into a small cup.
In a small saucepan, simmer 1/2 chicken breast half with zest in about 1 cup of chicken broth, covered, for 20 minutes, or until chicken is just cooked through.
Transfer chicken to a bowl and pour broth through a sieve into a measuring cup. Chill chicken until it is cool.
While chicken is cooling, trim 3 snow pea pods and cut diagonally into thin slivers.
In a 2-quart saucepan, heat 2/3 tablespoon butter over moderately low heat until foam subsides and stir in 2/3 tablespoon flour.
Cook roux, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes.
Add broth and 1 tablespoon of cream in a stream, whisking, and simmer, whisking, for 2 minutes, or until soup thickens slightly. Remove pan from heat.
When chicken is cool enough to handle, discard skin and bones and cut chicken into thin strips.
Add chicken and snow peas to soup and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 minute, or until peas are crisp-tender.
Stir in the lemon juice, 2/3 tablespoon of minced parsley, and salt and pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
Place eggs in a medium pan and cover with cold water. Turn heat to medium and cook until the water comes to a rolling boil. Reduce heat and continue cooking for 10 minutes. Remove the eggs and transfer in a bowl of cold water to stop the cooking. When the eggs have cooled, peel them, quarter, and set aside.
Place potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring the water to a simmer over medium heat, season with salt, and cook until the potatoes are just tender and easily pierced with a fork. Remove the potatoes from the water and rinse briefly under cool water. Add the carrots to the pot of water and cook until just tender, about 2 minutes. Rinse under cold water to stop the cooking. Slice the potatoes into 1/4-inch thick rounds and place in a large bowl along with the carrots. Add the celery, radishes, and red onion and stir to combine.
Combine the buttermilk, sour cream, and mustard in a small bowl. Add to the bowl with the potato mixture and toss until potatoes and vegetables are coated. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours so that flavors blend. Before serving, season with salt and pepper, to taste. Fold in the watercress and dill and top with quartered eggs. Serve chilled or bring to room temperature before serving.
ingredients: 1 medium carrot, quartered lengthwise and thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Place 0.33 eggs in a medium pan and cover with cold water.
Turn heat to medium and cook until the water comes to a rolling boil.
Reduce heat and continue cooking for 10 minutes.
Remove the eggs and transfer in a bowl of cold water to stop the cooking.
When the eggs have cooled, peel them, quarter, and set aside.
Place 0.17 pounds of potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water.
Bring the water to a simmer over medium heat, season with salt, and cook until the potatoes are just tender and easily pierced with a fork.
Remove the potatoes from the water and rinse briefly under cool water.
Add 0.08 carrots to the pot of water and cook until just tender, about 2 minutes.
Rinse under cold water to stop the cooking.
Slice the potatoes into 1/4-inch thick rounds and place in a large bowl along with the carrots.
Add 0.33 stalks of celery, 0.17 bunches of radishes, and 0.08 red onions and stir to combine.
Combine 0.08 cups of buttermilk, 0.33 cups of sour cream, and 0.08 tablespoons of mustard in a small bowl.
Add to the bowl with the potato mixture and toss until potatoes and vegetables are coated.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours so that flavors blend.
Before serving, season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Fold in 0.17 cups of watercress and 0.08 tablespoons of dill and top with quartered eggs.
Serve chilled or bring to room temperature before serving.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 200°F. Stir together flours, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add egg, buttermilk, and 2 tablespoons oil and stir just until blended. Stir in bacon. Heat a griddle or large heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot, then lightly brush with remaining 1/2 tablespoon oil. Working in batches and using a scant 1/4 cup per pancake, pour batter onto griddle and cook, turning over once, until golden, about 4 minutes total per batch. Keep warm, covered, in oven.
Preheat oven to 200°F.
Stir together flours, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add egg, buttermilk, and 2 tablespoons oil and stir just until blended. Stir in bacon.
Heat a griddle or large heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot, then lightly brush with remaining 1/2 tablespoon oil. Working in batches and using a scant 1/4 cup per pancake, pour batter onto griddle and cook, turning over once, until golden, about 4 minutes total per batch. Keep warm, covered, in oven.
ingredients: 1/4 lb sliced Canadian bacon, cut into 1/8-inch pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°F.
In a bowl, stir together 0.06 cup buckwheat flour, 0.06 cup all-purpose flour, 0.12 teaspoon sugar, 0.12 teaspoon baking powder, 0.06 teaspoon baking soda, and a pinch of salt.
Add 0.12 lightly beaten large egg, 0.16 cup buttermilk, and 0.31 tablespoon vegetable oil to the dry ingredients, and stir just until blended.
Stir in about 0.06 lb sliced Canadian bacon, cut into small pieces.
Heat a griddle or large heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot, then lightly brush with 0.06 tablespoon vegetable oil.
Working in batches, use a scant 0.06 cup per pancake, pour batter onto the griddle and cook, turning over once, until golden, about 4 minutes total per batch.
Keep the pancakes warm, covered, in the oven.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: Two 12-cup muffin tins
Warm 1/4 cup of the milk in a small saucepan over medium-low heat to anywhere between 100 and 115 degrees F. Pour the milk into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a hook attachment. Add the sugar and yeast, and let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. Add the softened butter, half the flour, half the remaining milk and fine salt. Mix on medium-high speed just to incorporate. Add the egg, mix until fully incorporated, then add the remaining flour and milk. Knead with the hook on medium-high speed until the dough is smooth and pulls away from the sides, about 5 minutes (the dough will still be sticky).
Lightly butter a large bowl with some of the melted butter, and turn the dough out into it. Cover with plastic wrap, and let stand in a slightly warm place until doubled in size, about 2 hours.
Lightly butter two 12-cup muffin tins with some of the melted butter. Punch the dough down. Divide it into 24 even pieces, and roll them into rough balls. Roll each ball in the melted butter to coat, letting the excess drip off, and plop it into a muffin cup. Cover lightly with plastic wrap, and let rise in the refrigerator at least 8 hours and up to 1 day.
Position oven racks in the lower and upper thirds of the oven, and preheat to 375 degrees F. Remove the tins from the refrigerator, and let stand at room temperature 1 hour (the dough won't puff up significantly). Sprinkle evenly with sea salt, and bake, rotating the tins halfway through, until just lightly golden but still rather pale and almost cooked through, 10 to 15 minutes.
Let the parbaked rolls cool slightly in the tins, then transfer to cooling racks to cool completely. Pack them in resealable plastic bags, label and date, and freeze for up to 2 weeks.
To serve, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Bake the frozen rolls on a parchment-lined baking sheet until warmed through and golden brown on top, about 20 minutes. Brush the warm rolls with melted butter.
ingredients: 1 cup whole milk, at room temperature
One 1/4-ounce package active dry yeast (about 2 1/4 teaspoons)
6 tablespoons softened unsalted butter, plus 6 tablespoons melted, plus more melted for brushing
step_by_step_instructions: Warm 0.06 cup of the milk in a small saucepan over medium-low heat to 100-115 degrees F.
Pour the milk into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a hook attachment.
Add 0.38 tablespoon of sugar and 0.28 teaspoon of yeast; let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.
Add 0.38 tablespoon of softened butter, 0.44 cup of flour, 0.19 cup of remaining milk, and 0.06 teaspoon of fine salt. Mix on medium-high speed to incorporate.
Add 0.04 of a beaten egg and mix until fully incorporated.
Add the remaining 0.44 cup of flour and 0.19 cup of milk.
Knead with the hook on medium-high speed until the dough is smooth and pulls away from the sides, about 5 minutes.
Lightly butter a large bowl with some melted butter and turn the dough out into it.
Cover with plastic wrap and let stand in a slightly warm place until doubled in size, about 2 hours.
Lightly butter two 12-cup muffin tins with some melted butter.
Punch the dough down and divide it into 1 even piece; roll it into a rough ball.
Roll the ball in melted butter to coat, letting the excess drip off, and plop it into a muffin cup.
Cover lightly with plastic wrap and let rise in the refrigerator for at least 8 hours and up to 1 day.
Position oven racks in the lower and upper thirds of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F.
Remove the tin from the refrigerator and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour.
Sprinkle evenly with sea salt and bake, rotating the tin halfway through, until just lightly golden, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Let the parbaked roll cool slightly in the tin, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.
Pack in a resealable plastic bag, label and date, and freeze for up to 2 weeks.
To serve, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and bake the frozen roll on a parchment-lined baking sheet until warmed through and golden brown on top, about 20 minutes.
Brush the warm roll with melted butter.

recipe_title: Chinatown Char Siu Barbeque Ribs or Pork
original_instructions:
Combine the marinade ingredients in a bowl and whisk thoroughly. Place the meat in a resealable plastic bag (you may need more than one), add the marinade, seal tightly, and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. Heat your cooker to 300°F. (You can also use an indoor oven. Just place the ribs on a wire grate over a pan or on a broiler pan.) If you are using a gas grill, turn off one or two burners and place the meat over the cool burners. If you are using a charcoal grill, set it up by banking the coals against one side for indirect cooking. Remove the ribs from the marinade and cook for about 1 hour; then paint the bone side of the ribs with a coat of the honey or char siu sauce. Cook for 10 minutes, underside up; then turn meat side up, paint with more honey or char siu sauce, and cook for another 10 minutes. Remove the ribs, let them sit for 5 minutes, cut them into individual ribs, and serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh chives.
Combine the marinade ingredients in a bowl and whisk thoroughly. Place the meat in a resealable plastic bag (you may need more than one), add the marinade, seal tightly, and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight.
Heat your cooker to 300°F. (You can also use an indoor oven. Just place the ribs on a wire grate over a pan or on a broiler pan.) If you are using a gas grill, turn off one or two burners and place the meat over the cool burners. If you are using a charcoal grill, set it up by banking the coals against one side for indirect cooking. Remove the ribs from the marinade and cook for about 1 hour; then paint the bone side of the ribs with a coat of the honey or char siu sauce. Cook for 10 minutes, underside up; then turn meat side up, paint with more honey or char siu sauce, and cook for another 10 minutes. Remove the ribs, let them sit for 5 minutes, cut them into individual ribs, and serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh chives.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons hot sauce, such as Asian chile sauce or Tabasco
2 tablespoons ground ginger or minced fresh ginger
2 teaspoons garlic powder or minced fresh garlic
2 slabs baby back ribs, cut in half lengthwise through all the bones
1/4 cup honey or char siu sauce
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.06 cup hoisin sauce, 0.06 cup brandy, 0.03 cup honey, 0.03 cup soy sauce, 0.38 tablespoon dark sesame oil, 0.38 tablespoon hot sauce, 0.38 tablespoon ground ginger, 0.25 teaspoon garlic powder, 0.25 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder, 0.38 tablespoon onion powder, and 0.25 teaspoon red food coloring in a bowl and whisk thoroughly.
Place approximately 0.25 slab of baby back ribs in a resealable plastic bag, add the marinade, seal tightly, and toss to coat.
Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
Heat your cooker to 300°F.
Remove the ribs from the marinade and cook for about 1 hour.
Paint the bone side of the ribs with 0.03 cup of honey.
Cook for 10 minutes, underside up.
Turn meat side up, paint with more honey, and cook for another 10 minutes.
Remove the ribs, let them sit for 5 minutes.
Cut them into individual ribs and serve hot, garnished with 0.25 tablespoon chopped fresh chives.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Place flank steak, red wine vinegar, zest lime juice, cilantro, hot sauce, Worcestershire, salt and ground black pepper in a large plastic bag. Marinate for 1 hour in the refrigerator. Remove flank steak and pat dry. Place in freezer for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, prepare the sauce: Melt butter over medium heat-high heat in a sauce pot. Add flour, chipotle and adobo sauce, stir to combine. Add heavy cream slowly, stirring well with each addition to incorporate. Add cheese and stir until melted. Keep over low heat while finishing sandwich.
Remove flank steak from freezer and slice on the bias against the grain into 1/4-inch thick pieces. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a cast iron griddle or skillet, and saute the red peppers until they blacken around the edges, and soften, about 8 minutes. Remove from griddle and turn heat to medium-high, add more oil if necessary and sear steak in batches, about 2 minutes.
To assemble the sandwiches: Cut bread loaves in half, leaving 1 side attached. Layer on avocado slices, top with flank steak, red pepper, and cilantro. Drizzle with chipotle cheese sauce and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, plus more if needed for steak
1 red bell pepper, cut into strips
1 avocado, pitted and flesh sliced 1/4-inch thick
step_by_step_instructions: Marinate 4 ounces of flank steak with 2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar, juice and zest of 0.25 lime, 1 tablespoon of chopped cilantro, 0.25 teaspoon of hot sauce, 0.25 teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce, 0.25 teaspoon of salt, and 0.125 teaspoon of black pepper in a large plastic bag. Place in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Remove the flank steak from the refrigerator and pat dry. Place in the freezer for 1 hour.
While the steak is in the freezer, melt 0.5 tablespoon of unsalted butter in a sauce pot over medium-high heat.
Add 0.75 tablespoon of all-purpose flour, 0.5 chopped chipotle chile in adobo, and 0.25 tablespoon of adobo sauce to the pot, stirring to combine.
Slowly add 0.375 cup of heavy cream, stirring well with each addition to incorporate.
Add 0.25 cup of processed grated Cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Keep the sauce over low heat.
Remove the flank steak from the freezer and slice on the bias against the grain into 0.25-inch thick pieces.
Heat 0.25 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a cast iron griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Sauté 0.25 red bell pepper, cut into strips, until blackened around the edges and softened, about 8 minutes. Remove from the griddle.
Add more oil if necessary and sear the steak slices in batches, about 2 minutes per batch.
Cut 1 hoagie roll in half, leaving 1 side attached.
Layer 0.25 avocado, sliced 0.25-inch thick, onto the hoagie roll.
Top with the seared flank steak slices, sautéed red pepper strips, and 0.25 cup of cilantro leaves.
Drizzle with the prepared chipotle cheese sauce and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: A deep-fry thermometer and plastic piping bags
Add the oil to a deep pot and heat it over medium-high heat until it registers 375 degrees F on a deep-fry thermometer. Set up a work surface with 4 or 5 plastic piping bags, scissors, tongs, parchment paper, and a wire rack with parchment paper underneath.
In a big bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and granulated sugar. Add the eggs and milk and whisk well. Get all the lumps out!
Fill all the piping bags with batter. Cut the tip off one bag and drizzle the batter straight into the hot oil in a swirly, crazy pattern. Toss the piping bag. When one side is golden brown, about 75 seconds, carefully flip the funnel cake with tongs and fry the other side, another 75 seconds. Fry the rest of the batter.
Drain the funnel cakes on the wire rack. While they're still warm and shiny, dust them with powdered sugar using a wire-mesh strainer. Serve immediately!
step_by_step_instructions: Add about 3.75 oz (or approximately 111 ml) of vegetable oil to a deep pot and heat it over medium-high heat until it registers 375 degrees F on a deep-fry thermometer.
Set up a work surface with 1 plastic piping bag, scissors, tongs, parchment paper, and a wire rack with parchment paper underneath.
In a bowl, whisk together 0.38 cup of all-purpose flour, 0.25 teaspoon of baking powder, 0.13 teaspoon of salt, 0.13 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, and 0.06 cup of granulated sugar.
Add 0.38 of an extra-large egg (approximately 20 g) and 0.25 cup of milk to the mixture and whisk well to remove all lumps.
Fill the piping bag with batter. Cut the tip off the bag and drizzle the batter straight into the hot oil in a swirly, crazy pattern.
Toss the piping bag. When one side of the funnel cake is golden brown, about 75 seconds, carefully flip it with tongs and fry the other side for another 75 seconds.
Drain the funnel cake on the wire rack. While it's still warm and shiny, dust it with approximately 0.25 cup of powdered sugar using a wire-mesh strainer.
Serve immediately!

original_instructions:
Whisk together the yeast and 1/4 cup of the water in a small bowl and let sit for 5 minutes to proof. Place 1 3/4 cups of the flour in a large bowl with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Add the yeast mixture, the remaining water and oil and stir until combined. Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead until smooth. Grease a large bowl with the remaining oil, add the dough and turn to coat. Cover and place in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Preheat the grill to high. Once the dough has risen, divide it in half, and then divide each half into 2 balls. Roll each ball into an 8-inch circle. Brush with oil and grill on both sides until golden brown. Remove from grill and slice each in half horizontally.
Spread bottom halves of pizza with 3 ounces of the robiolo cheese and 2 ounces of the mozzarella. Season with salt and pepper. Place the tops on and heat on the grill for 30 seconds. Remove from the grill and drizzle each pizza top with a few teaspoons of white truffle oil. Slice into wedges and serve immediately.
ingredients: 3/4 cup warm water (105 to 115 degrees F)
1 3/4 to 2 cups unbleached all-purpose flour plus additional for kneading and dredging
2 teaspoons olive oil, plus 1 teaspoon for greasing the bowl
12 ounces robiolo cheese, at room temperature
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together 0.56 teaspoons of active dry yeast and 0.06 cups of warm water in a small bowl and let sit for 5 minutes to proof.
Place 0.44 cups of unbleached all-purpose flour in a large bowl with 0.38 teaspoons of salt.
Add the yeast mixture, 0.19 cups of remaining water, and 0.5 teaspoons of olive oil and stir until combined.
Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead until smooth.
Grease a large bowl with 0.25 teaspoons of olive oil, add the dough and turn to coat.
Cover and place in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 to 1.5 hours.
Preheat the grill to high.
Once the dough has risen, divide it in half, and then divide each half into 2 balls.
Roll one ball into an 8-inch circle.
Brush with oil and grill on both sides until golden brown.
Remove from grill and slice in half horizontally.
Spread the bottom half with 0.75 ounces of robiolo cheese and 0.5 ounces of buffalo mozzarella.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place the top on and heat on the grill for 30 seconds.
Remove from the grill and drizzle with a few teaspoons of white truffle oil.
Slice into wedges and serve immediately.

original_instructions: To make the honey mustard: Whisk the mustard, honey, mayonnaise, and hot sauce together in a medium bowl. To make the chicken: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Rinse the chicken and pat dry. If using 2 large breasts, then place the chicken breasts on a cutting board and halve them horizontally so you end up with 4 pieces of even thickness (if using chicken cutlets, skip this step). If the chicken pieces are thicker than 1/2 inch, place a large sheet of plastic wrap on a cutting board and set 1 piece of chicken on top. Cover with another sheet of plastic wrap and then pound the chicken to a 1/2-inch thickness using a meat mallet or a heavy-bottomed pot. Season the chicken with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Add the chicken to the bowl with the mustard mixture and turn to coat. In a second medium bowl, stir together the bread crumbs, thyme, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Dredge each piece of chicken through the bread crumbs, gently pressing the crumbs into each side. Place a metal cooling rack on top of a baking sheet, and mist the rack with spray.
